3,4,5,6:
have one's wrinkles removed
去皱

I think getting wrinkles is a natural thing. I don't want to have them removed.

4,5,6,7:
have one's behind lifted
提臀
behind在这里指臀部,如 She fell and landed on her behind.

1:
seriously 
adv. 确实地, 表示赞同对方的观点, 有一点调侃的意味

-I can't afford to fail this exam.
-Seriously.

-Can you believe this? I got No.1 in my exam.
-Seriously?
当seriously的语气变成疑问句时, 就成了"真的假的啊"的意思了.

2,3,4,5:
have sth. done
把某物...
(一般是让别人做这件事而非自己亲自做)
这个句型是这篇课文的核心,一直重复出现

remodel 
[ˌriː'mɑdl]	
v. 改型

I will have my telephone line repaired today.
我今天会把我的电话线路修一下.

4,5,6,7:
have sth. packed up
把...包起来

I want to have the gift packed up please.

4,5,6:
a big deal
一件大事

Calm down! Failing one exam is not a big deal!
9,10,11,12:
get sth. done
= have sth. done
把某物...
(一般是让别人做这件事而非自己亲自做)

1,2,3,4,5,6,7,8:
This is exactly what I've been looking for.
这正是我一直想要找的.
固定用法

4,5,6,7:
get one's ear flattened
压平耳朵(把招风耳压平)

2,3,4:
by the way
顺便提一下

Enjoy your holiday, by the way, don't forget your passport.

3,4,5,6:
have one's nose fixed
修鼻(整容)

My mum doesn't like her nose and has always wanted to have it fixed.
